alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated rain continuing. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area, including on Highways 168 and 395. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bishop, Big Pine, Independence, Baker Creek Campground, Glacier View Campground, Tinemaha Campground, Taboose Creek Campground, Goodale Creek Campground, Wilkerson, Browns Town Campground, Millpond Campground, Independence Creek Campground, Pleasant Valley Campground, Mesa, Round Valley, West Bishop, Dixon Lane-Meadow and Dixon Lane-Meadow Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
